Campaign: Ming forces defeat Arughtai east of the Greater Khingan and withdraw to Nanjing |- | 1414 || April || Second Mongol Campaign: Ming forces engage Oirats at the Tuul River, suffering heavy casualties, but ultimately prevail through the use of heavy cannon bombardments |- | 1422 || | April || Third Mongol Campaign: Ming forces are dispatched against Arughtai but fail to engage him in Esen Taishi of the Oirats and de facto ruler of the Northern Yuan launches an invasion of the Ming dynasty |- | 4 August || Tumu Crisis: The Zhengtong Emperor departs from Beijing to personally confront Esen Taishi |- | 30 August || Tumu Crisis: The Ming rearguard is defeated |- | 1 September || Tumu Crisis: The Ming army is annihilated and the Zhengtong Emperor is captured by Esen Taishi |- | 27 October || Esen Taishi lays siege to Beijing but fails to take it and withdraws after 5 days |- | 1451 || || Esen Taishi declares himself Yuan Emperor, which causes widespread dissent among his followers |- | 1454 || || Esen Taishi is killed and the Northern Yuan is once more split into two portions between the Oirats and Eastern Mongols |- | 1479 || || Dayan Khan becomes ruler of Northern
